snippet.title: Jason Momoa EXPOSES The TRUTH About Working With Amber Heard!
snippet.description:
Just a few days ago, the first day of filming for Aquaman 2, entitled Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom, finally started, and obviously, many were not happy about it. For starters, Warner Brothers decided to push through on their initial decision to keep Amber Heard in the newest DC Extended Universe movie franchise, despite the lsuit and all the drama with Johnny Depp that she is currently involved in. Because of this, many fans are campaigning to stop production of the entire movie, as they believe that not only does Amber Heard deserve for her movie to flop, but the whole Warner Brothers production as well. But the problem here is there will be many other actors that will be affected once people go against it, and that includes major actors such as Nicole Kidman, Patrick Wilson, Willem Dafoe, Randall Park, and of course, Aquaman himself, Jason Momoa. For many Jason Momoa and Johnny Depp fans, this is a pretty tough decision to make. Johnny and Amber are in not just a rocky situation these days, they are facing a huge case before them, and supporting Amber Heard‚Äôs movie is basically supporting her. So, many fans want to know, what does Jason Momoa have to say about working with Amber Heard? Is he also tired of her drama? Does he think she is a good or bad person? Or will he defend her against Johnny Depp? Well, I guess you‚Äôll need to stick around until the end of this video to find out. But before that, please make sure you subscribe first, and hit that notification bell for more updates. So, let‚Äôs begin!

The year 2021 may not be big for the DC universe, as movie theaters are still just reopening and many restrictions are still ongoing. As you all remember, Wonder Woman 1984 had been a much awaited film before the illness, but somehow this subsided the excitement. However, Warner Brothers remained hopeful for their second installment of the Aquaman movie. Despite the challenges that are uncertain by the time of its release, they are still going to push through on this major project, and in fact, they have already started filming the movie. Good decision, people might say. But there‚Äôs one big catch in the movie that many fans did not love, and it‚Äôs that Warner Brothers should really care more about one certain cast member. Just by the facts mentioned, you‚Äôd already conclude that Amber is not cool at all. Despite all these occurrences, Warner Brothers still kept her and even gave her the role of Queen Mera, while the same production company let go of Johnny Depp from his supposed upcoming film Fantastic Beasts 3 that is also set to be released in 2022. Obviously, many fans are not happy. The first installment of Aquaman was no doubt a huge success, both commercially and cinematically. The movie, directed by James Wan, was a depiction of an entirely new world, and it was surreal how they put all of them together in a manner that would not bore anyone. Indeed, it was worth watching again and again. And the 2018 movie‚Äôs success really reflected on its box office earnings, reaching 1.184 billion dollars, with a production budget of 160 to 200 million dollars. Because of the first film‚Äôs success, fans became very excited for the second installment right away, but after the movie‚Äôs success, case after case brought Amber Heard to the spotlight again, but this time in a very negative way. Now, obviously, people would automatically think that Warner Brothers would relieve Amber Heard from her role as Queen Mera. 

But amidst all this craziness in the entertainment industry, fans have been wondering, what is Amber Heard like as a co-star? During the Johnny and Amber battle, many celebrities have already pointed out that Amber isn‚Äôt exactly a truth-teller. A lot of film colleagues have stood by Johnny Depp through all these, defending him from Amber. But how about the insights of those who work with Amber? One of these celebrities is Jason Momoa, and he has got a lot to say.

Well, much to fan‚Äôs dismay, Jason Momoa reportedly has no problems with Amber Heard at all. Despite Warner Brother‚Äôs rogue decision to keep Amber Heard, which might actually cause their new movie to flop, at least Warner Brothers is somehow trying to reduce Amber Heard‚Äôs exposure. So let‚Äôs talk about Jason Momoa. Jason will be back as Arthur Curry in the upcoming Aquaman 2 movie.

 But in the end, it‚Äôs Warner Brothers‚Äô call, and after all, we just hope it won‚Äôt affect the other actors that much. That‚Äôs all for today, hope you enjoyed our video and we‚Äôll see you next time. Don‚Äôt forget to like, subscribe, and smash that notification bell for more videos like this.

snippet.title: Warner Brothers Wants To FIRE Amber Heard From Aquaman 2 NOW?!
snippet.description:
Just a few hours after Warner Brothers announced that they‚Äôd started filming the second installment of the DC Extended universe film, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom, people were quick to react negatively, causing the first filming day of the said movie to flop early on and trend in pretty bad ways. Why? As you remember, Warner Brothers stuck with their initial decision to keep Amber Heard in Aquaman‚Äôs second movie despite her involvement in the lawsuits with Johnny Depp, and despite the same production company‚Äôs reckless decision to fire Johnny from his iconic role as Grindelwald in the third installment of the Fantastic Beasts film trilogy. Because of this, many fans were outraged, as they should have been, because of the so-called unfair treatment between the former couple. However, despite garnering almost two million signatures in a petition for Warner Brothers to fire Amber, the production company still pushed through on casting her. Many fans were angered by this, and as a result, they vowed to boycott the upcoming Aquaman movie in 2022. Many said they would not watch it so that Amber Heard and the rest of Warner Brothers get their well-deserved downfall. All this time, Warner Brothers never bent their decision, but now that they are experiencing a major backlash in social media due to mean comments about their film and Amber Heard, will they finally regret casting her? What are fans saying about Warner brothers now? Will the movie and the production company itself plummet to the ground? Let‚Äôs find out in this video. But before that, make sure first to subscribe to our channel and hit that notification bell for more updates. Now, let‚Äôs begin!

The first day of filming of the new movie sequel Aquaman and The Lost Kingdom was expected to be huge news to its fans, but rather, it turned out to be a big flop. What made it an even bigger disappointment for Warner Brothers is that the first Aquaman movie turned out to be a major blockbuster success in 2018, reaching 1.184 billion dollars, with a production budget of only 160 to 200 million dollars. That‚Äôs a lot of profit! However, after the first release of the first movie, one of the main actresses, Amber Heard, had been involved in a lawsuit with Johnny Depp, all brought about by their messy marriage and split. And even though Amber played the victim at first, soon enough, evidence surfaced proving her as a ‚Äúliar and a manipulator‚Äù to use one of Johnny Depp‚Äôs co-stars‚Äô words. And aside from the stuff that Amber told the public, there was evidence of her having affairs during her marriage with Johnny, a phone call record proving she was the one who actually lifted a finger on Johnny, and a missing 7 million dollars worth of charity donations. Because of this evidence and allegations, Amber Heard had turned into one of the most despised celebrities today real quick. Now, having someone with a bad image to star along with a few of the highest paid actors in the industry is actually a big risk for a huge production company like Warner Brothers, and that‚Äôs why people are so confused why Warner Brothers kept her from getting fired. But apart from this, Warner Brothers are reportedly trying to reduce Amber‚Äôs screen time, a matter which Jason Momoa and the director, James Wan himself, kind of disagree about.

Everywhere you look on social media, there were mean comments about Amber, and sadly, about the upcoming Aquaman film itself. There‚Äôs no doubt that the first Aquaman directed by James Wan was a huge hit. Here are some of the nastiest reactions of fans about Warner Brother‚Äôs firm decision to keep Amber Heard.

When Aquaman director James Wan posted on social media a photo of a clapperboard hinting on their start of filming,  it was overshadowed by negative comments with almost 3,000 tweets. One social media user took it to twitter and said, ‚ÄúWhen you see that Warner Bros kept Amber Heard onboard for Aquaman 2, but still haven't brought back Johnny for 'Fantastic Beasts'. #FireAmberHeard, with a GIF of a man throwing tantrums in a kitchen. Some twitter users even made social media memes out of it making fun of their excited reactions when Aquaman 2 was announced but then changed it to disgust after learning that Amber Heard will be in it. While another twitter user did not use any more fuss and just directly said, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt care, just fire Amber Heard‚Äù. 

That‚Äôs all for today, we hope you enjoyed that video, and if you did, don‚Äôt forget to smash that like button, subscribe to the channel and hit that notification bell for more videos like this.

Related videos:
Heard ACCIDENTALLY REVEALS her ENTIRE DESPERATE PLAN! It's Game OVER!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d9QPdFNRmWg

Aquaman 2 FLOPS on its FIRST DAY of FILMING, PROVING Heard is DONE!

snippet.localized.description: Surprise! Amber Heard is a mom! The 35-year-old actress announced the birth of her daughter, Oonagh Paige Heard, on her social media accounts on Thursday. Amber revealed her baby girl was born on April 8. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so excited to share this news with you,‚Äù Amber wrote on Twitter, captioning a precious photo of herself cradling little Oonagh. ‚ÄúFour years ago, I decided I wanted to have a child. I wanted to do it on my own terms. I now appreciate how radical it is for us as women to think about one of the most fundamental parts of our destinies in this way.‚Äù
